title: Jesmanowicz Conjecture and Gaussian Integer Ring
content: Let a,b,c be positive integers such that a2+b2=c2, 2|b,gcd(a,b)=1. In 1956, Jesmanowicz conjectured that for any positive integer w, the only solution of (aw)x+(bw)y=(cw)z in positive integers is (x, y, z) = (2, 2, 2). In this paper, based on Gaussian integer ring, we show that Je$\acute{s}$manowicz' conjecture is true for any positive integer
